required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase III Study to Evaluate the Immunogenicity and Safety of MG1109 in Healthy Adult Volunteers
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized, Double Blind, Multicenter, Phase III Study to Evaluate the Immunogenicity and Safety of 'MG1109(Egg-based, Pre-pandemic Influenza(H5N1) Vaccine)' Administered Intramuscularly in Healthy Adult Volunteers

oversight_info.authority: South Korea: Ministry of Food and Drug Safety(MFDS)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the immunogenicity and safety of the investigational vaccine in the subjects during their participation in the study.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Prevention

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of subjects achieving post-vaccination Hemagglutination Inhibition(HI) antibody titer â‰¥ 1:40
Percentage of subjects achieving post-vaccination seroconversion for Hemagglutination Inhibition(HI) antibody
GMR(Geometric Mean Ratio) of Hemagglutination Inhibition(HI) antibody titer at post-vaccination compared to pre-vaccination
The percentage of subjects reporting solicited adverse events from the date of vaccination until 7 days after each vaccination
primary_outcome.time_frame: Each vaccination ~ 7 days after each vaccination

primary_outcome.measure: The percentage of subjects reporting unsolicited adverse events from the date of 1st vaccination until 24weeks after 2nd vaccination

secondary_outcome.measure: GMT(Geometric Mean Titer) of Hemagglutination Inhibition(HI) antibody titer pre-vaccination and post-vaccination
GMT(Geometric Mean Titer) and GMR(Geometric Mean Ratio) of neutralizing antibody titer pre-vaccination and post-vaccination

intervention.description: Investigational Product : MG1109 Dose : 0.5 mL Intramuscularly injection, twice at an interval of 21 days

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy adults who are available for follow-up during the study
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects with history of exposure to the H5N1 subtype or H5N1 subtype vaccine
- Subjects with immune system disorder including immune deficiency disease

facility.name: Catholic University Of Korea ST. Vincent's Hospital
